main event: Colonel J.A. Coleman, Lt. Col. J.L. Thomas, and Capt. R.L. Burgess observed a circular metallic object moving at high speed on May 9, 1952.
interesting points: The object was visible for approximately 10 minutes., It appeared smooth-edged and metallic in color., The observers used binoculars and also noticed the object with the naked eye., There was no sound associated with the object., The weather conditions were clear with mild winds.
witness description: Colonel J.A. Coleman, Lt. Col. J.L. Thomas, and Capt. R.L. Burgess
